(Same JS 309 1) This course will be taught online. It meets for two synchronous 75-minute sessions per week on TTh.
This course satisfies the new Religion major requirement:- Tradition-Judaism. 
Over the last 200 years, Jews and Judaism have undergone tumultuous social, political, religious and cultural changes. In this course, we will examine the reasons for these changes, and explore the emergence and development of Reform, Conservative, Orthodox and other Judaisms as well as Zionism. The last month will focus on recent trends in American religion and their impact on 21st-century Jewish life and self-understanding, with a particular focus on learning to interpret and contextualize current events in contemporary media.
course_description: Modern Jewish history, society, and thought, with emphasis on religious and secular reformulations of Jewish self-identity.
